title: What are examples of people who got lost in the wild and somehow survived? - Quora

response.answer_text: The key is that usually they don’t “somehow survive”. They want to survive with all their will. Every scenario is different. There was a woman some years back who wandered off the Appalachian Trail in Maine— probably to go to the bathroom. And ended up dying, lost, not far from it. A bit understandable if you’ve ever tried to move through the Maine woods— there is a reason Stephen King sets some of his horror there besides he grew up there. The key thing is to remember the phrase SURVIVAL From the Procastinator’s Survival Guide (and pretty much every survival manual): The word Survival provides you with the first letters of the keys you need. S - Size up the situation, your surroundings, yourself, and your equipment. U - Use All Your Senses & Undue Haste Makes Waste R - Remember Where You Are V - Vanquish Fear and Panic I - Improvise V - Value Living A - Act Like the Natives L - Live by Your Wits
